intro: Trigoniastrum hypoleucum var. oliganthum, commonly known as the white-flowered trigoniastrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
